channel.title: Apple software and phones at risk of hacking
channel.description:
Well ironically I just recently [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,659332.0.html]posted[/url] about how malevolent Jobs used to be, and now I'm finding very recent articles regarding Apple's security. It's very important that if you have any Apple products that you read up on this stuff to understand what it's all about. Whether or not Apple did this on purpose for the NSA or just make an incredibly stupid mistake, I'll leave that for you to decide.
[b]About Apple security:[/b] http://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/feb/22/apple-ios-software-hacking-risk
[b]Noob-friendly infographic about the actual security issue:[/b] http://www.venafi.com/assets/img/blogs/ITs-Dirty-Little-Secret-Infographic-800x5604.jpg

item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

The two links you posted have nothing to do with each other. The article is about a flaw in Apple’s SSL implementation and the graphic is just a rant about how organisations suck at managing SSH keys.

We’ve all known about these SSL flaws for some time… I’m pretty sure one of Snowden’s leaks was that most SSL implementations are broken. And even if they were implemented correctly, the NSA can easily forge certificates anyway because all they have to do is ask a CA.
